graph

Class DSPPFinderFwdSrch

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.DSPPFinderFwdSrch

  • public class DSPPFinderFwdSrch
extends java.lang.Object
    A parallel/distributed version of the "Shortest Path Calculation by Forward- Search" algorithm described on page 308 in Bertsekas & Tsitsiklis, "Parallel and Distributed Computation: Numerical Methods", Prentice-Hall, 1989 (1st ed). The algorithm works on connected graphs containing nonnegative edge weights. This method should provide good performance when asked to re-optimize a shortest path computation after some nodes have been removed (assuming we have the previous shortest distances from the source to the destination, and we use it for the next estimates h, by reversing the direction of the graph, and asking for a path on the reverse pair (destination-to-source); in such a case, the previous values d[j] are under-estimates of the shortest distance from node j to the new destination (previous source)). This is what the method getKDisjointShortestPaths(s,t,k) does after it computes the first (best) path from s to t. Notice that in the latter method, the reason we alternate between Dijkstra's method and the Forward-Search method, is simply that Forward Search does not guarantee that the labels it returns are actually shortest path distances for any node other than the destination node, and therefore are not guaranteed under-estimates for the distances of nodes to the new destination in the next problem iteration.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2017

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      • DSPPFinderFwdSrch

        public DSPPFinderFwdSrch(Graph g,
                         java.lang.String graphfilename,
                         java.lang.String pdbthost,
                         int pdbtport,
                         int distr_min_size)
        sole public constructor.
        Parameters:
        g - Graph
        graphfilename - String the filename describing the graph
        pdbthost - String the ip address of the parallel.distributed.PDBatchTaskExecutorSrv that will accept the various tasks the algorithm will create
        pdbtport - int the port where the parallel.distributed.PDBatchTaskExecutorSrv server listens.
        distr_min_size - int the minimum size the list L in the execution of the algorithm should have at any point for it to be distributed.

    • Method Detail

      • getShortestPath

        public double getShortestPath(Node s,
                              Node t,
                              double[] h)
        compute the cost of the shortest path between two nodes in the graph passed in this object as first argument in its constructor. The path will consist of forward edges in the directed graph only, and the cost is the sum of all weights of the edges in the path. Only non-negative arc weights are assumed to exist in the graph. Will return Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if there is no such path. This method is thread-safe and may be invoked concurrently with other threads invoking the same method with different start and destination nodes, or different under-estimates.
        Parameters:
        s - Node start node
        t - Node target node
        h - double[] valid under-estimates of the distance of each node with id (in [0,..._g.getNumNodes()-1]) i to the target node t. Such a valid underestimate is h[i]=0 for all i, and will be assumed if h is null
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if s or t are null

      • getKDisjointShortestPaths

        public java.util.List getKDisjointShortestPaths(Node s,
                                                Node t,
                                                int k)
        find the k totally disjoint shortest paths from s to t (or as many as they exist), having no arcs in common with each other.
        Parameters:
        s - Node
        t - Node
        k - int
        Returns:
        List // List<List<Integer nodeid> > list of up to k lists containing the paths of node-ids starting from s and leading to t. The last element of each path-list will be the actual cost of the path. The list will be empty if no such path exists
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if s or t are null or k<1

      • getLastFoundShortestPath

        public java.util.List getLastFoundShortestPath(Node s,
                                               Node t)
        get the actual shortest path from source to destination, as computed by a previous call to getShortestPath(s,t,h).
        Parameters:
        s - Node
        t - Node
        Returns:
        List // List<Integer nodeid> starting with s.getId(), and ending with t.getId() if a shortest path exists
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if s or t are null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no path exists or if no previous call to getShortestPath() has been made.

        public double[] getBestPathEstimates(int srcid,
                                     int destid)

        Parameters:

        destid - int
        Returns:
